SEARCH

Package org.apache.sis.metadata.iso.quality

package org.apache.sis.metadata.iso.quality
Information about data quality, accuracy and consistency of a dataset. An explanation for this package is provided in the OpenGIS® javadoc. The remaining discussion on this page is specific to the SIS implementation.

Null values, nil objects and collections

All constructors and setter methods accept null arguments. A null argument value means that the metadata element cannot be provided, and the reason for that is unspecified. Alternatively, users can specify why a metadata element is missing by providing a value created by Nil­Reason​.create­Nil­Object(Class).

Unless otherwise noted in the Javadoc, all getter methods may return an empty collection, an empty array or null if the type is neither a collection or an array. Note that non-null values may be Nil­Objects.

Unless the metadata object has been marked as unmodifiable and unless otherwise noted in the Javadoc, all collections returned by getter methods are live: adding new elements in the collection modify directly the underlying metadata object.

Since:
0.3

Defined in the sis-metadata module

    org.apache.sis.metadata.iso
    Root package for ISO 19115 metadata about resources (data or services).

    Renamed Abstract­Temporal­Quality for following a renaming in ISO 19157:2013.

    Accuracy of the temporal attributes and temporal relationships of features.

    Accuracy and correctness of attributes and classification of features.
    DefaultAbsoluteExternalPositionalAccuracy
    Closeness of reported coordinate values to values accepted as or being true.

    Correctness of the temporal references of an item (reporting of error in time measurement).

    Aggregation or derivation method.
    DefaultBasicMeasure
    Data quality basic measure.
    DefaultCompletenessCommission
    Excess data present in the dataset, as described by the scope.
    DefaultCompletenessOmission
    Data absent from the dataset, as described by the scope.
    DefaultConceptualConsistency
    Adherence to rules of the conceptual schema.
    DefaultConfidence
    Trustworthiness of a data quality result.
    DefaultConformanceResult
    Information about the outcome of evaluating the value(s) against a specified acceptable conformance quality level.
    DefaultCoverageResult
    Result of a data quality measure organising the measured values as a coverage.
    DefaultDataQuality
    Quality information for the data specified by a data quality scope.
    DefaultDescriptiveResult
    Data quality descriptive result.
    DefaultDomainConsistency
    Adherence of values to the value domains.
    DefaultEvaluationMethod
    Description of the evaluation method and procedure applied.
    DefaultEvaluationReportInformation
    Reference to an external standalone quality report.
    DefaultFormatConsistency
    Degree to which data are stored in accordance with the physical structure of the data set.
    DefaultFullInspection
    Full inspection.
    DefaultGriddedDataPositionalAccuracy
    Closeness of gridded data position values to values accepted as or being true.

    DefaultQuantitativeResult

    DefaultRelativeInternalPositionalAccuracy
    Closeness of the relative positions of features in the scope to their respective relative positions accepted as or being true.
    DefaultRepresentativity
    Degree to which the sample used has produced a result which is representation of the data.
    DefaultSampleBasedInspection
    Sample based inspection.
    DefaultScope
    Deprecated.
    As of ISO 19115:2014, DQ_Scope has been replaced by MD_Scope.
    DefaultSourceReference
    Reference to the source of the data quality measure.
    DefaultTemporalConsistency
    Correctness of ordered events or sequences, if reported.
    DefaultTemporalValidity
    Validity of data specified by the scope with respect to time.
    DefaultThematicClassificationCorrectness
    Comparison of the classes assigned to features or their attributes to a universe of discourse.
    DefaultTopologicalConsistency
    Correctness of the explicitly encoded topological characteristics of the data set.
    DefaultUsability
    Deprecated.
    Removed from latest ISO 19157 standard.
